wikipedia_page.main: Colin Cook (8 January 1909 – 15 September 1976) was an English professional footballer who played as a centre forward in the Football League for South Shields, Bradford City, Chesterfield, Luton Town and Northampton Town. He also played non-league football for Preston Colliery, Percy Main Amateurs, North Shields, Crook Town, Horden Colliery Welfare and Blyth Spartans.
